text:
Hello, I have been tasked to create a hierarchy in an existing HubSpot blog. We are currently using tags to create parent/children relations but I was asked to go deeper with grandchildren, without using tags if possible.
*This just seems impossible within the blog tool. Or is it?*
I could not find anything in the docs.
Thanks!
Hi Nico, you can use something like this: <https://www.gonzalotorreras.com/blog/sub-categories-in-blog-posts>
Thanks I'll look into it

you can setup a redirect in HubSpot for the root domain to go to www.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/connect-a-domain-to-HubSpot>

Hello. We’re looking for a solution that “Line items” would have a parent list and all of this lists would have different prices for the line items. I’m not sure how that would be called - probably Vendor Price list. As example, if the product A in list A would cost 5$. Then the product A would cost in list B 7$. But the products are exactly the same. It’s more for wholesales or different sales channels. Would something like that be possible and to change it on the quotes? Thx, Thomas.
Anyone ever disconnect a domain and have every single file / image break? How’d you work around it? :sweat_smile:
Was it your default file manager hosting domain by any chance? :grimacing:
Yep
Can you do a bulk redirect from the disconnected domain to the new domain?
The client didn’t want to connect more than one domain because of cost – I take it you’ve seen this before? Please tell me there’s a work around :pray::skin-tone-2: :bangbang:
<@U0392S20HV3> Do redirects work if its in an `<img src="olddomain/image.png">` ?

If this were something like wp I’d just run a sql query… Worst case I could go into each module and run a replace filter on all media values… but then it would be a rogue forked theme of our boilerplate :exploding_head:

Yes, the redirects will work on all URLs and files.

HubSpot has flexible redirects:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/set-up-a-flexible-pattern-url-redirect>
It might be easier to reconnect the domain, and follow this process: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/change-the-primary-domain-for-your-HubSpot-content>
Anyone else experiencing downtime on CRM card requests?
I'm getting an error on our app but also a couple of other apps too - nothing showing on the status page
Yes
and nothing in the application monitoring
we messaged support and they said they got multiple reports and are investigating FYI
Yes, I am getting lots of errors.
Ok great that's good to know :+1:
Monitoring shows that our CRM card endpoints have not been hit for about an hour.
I havent seen any requests in the Monitoring > CRM Extensions
yeah same <@U03CXPQBYBF>
it would be nice for <https://status.HubSpot.com/> to be updated :disappointed:
I agree. Status should be down for Integrations.
or at least "Investigating" :slightly_smiling_face:
:wink:
Things might be back. My CRM card endpoints just got hit....
Yes, things are working now!
same
Well I am glad this happened so that I could contact support and learn about this Slack channel. This is going to be very helpful in the future....
:raised_hands:
Hey all! Joined here looking for info on the GraphQL Beta! Anyone mind pointing me in the right direction? :smile:

Welcome, David! Jump on into <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content>, and feel free to check out <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages>
What are you looking to build using the new GraphQL BETA?
If you DM me your account ID, I can grant it access to the BETA
We do now have a<https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/bwg0btvhhg2y| status page> up for this incident FYI

Does anyone know if when you sign up for HubSpot and you have several companies all signed up together if you have separate contacts for the companies or if they are all combined in the one account? If they are separate what is the mechanism for identifying the various company? I see a company object in the contacts, but is that like the company the contact works for or is it internal usage?

Awesome, will do right now.

We’ve got a simple Chrome Extension to help us highlight Deals on the board, but I’d like to augment them a bit (and get rid of some secondary systems we’re using to store info)

Hey HubSpotters,

I have a specific question around multiple domains into single account.

*Here's the use case/question:*
For my next project, I have more than 10 publications/newsletters that I want to migrate to HubSpot single account. In future number of publications will grow to more than 30. So technically having a different brand account is not financially sustainable (because of $1000/month is so expensive)

So Questions are:
• Can we have more than one custom domain in one single account? If Yes, is there any limit?
• Can we have more than one EMAIL domain connected into single account? Because each publication has different website and different domains from where we want to send newsletters emails. 
• If yes, is HubSpot the right choice in this kind of business where we have more than 10 publications and in future it will grow to more than 30 publications ? 
Appreciate your insight and expertise.

TIA.
~Keyur
hey all, wondering if it's possible to enrich company data in the CRM (with the CRM cards feature) with this publicly accessible database <https://abr.business.gov.au/Tools/WebServices>
